title: 5 Must-See Shows if You’re in New York This Month
title_page: 5 Must-See Shows if You’re in New York This Month - The New York Times
text:
ON THE SHORE OF THE WIDE WORLD The British playwright Simon Stephens has become one of the theater’s most poignant chroniclers of everyday lives in upheaval. Best known for his Tony-winning adaptation of Mark Haddon’s “The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time,” Mr. Stephens has also written a series of quieter, diamond-faceted dramas in which static existences are shaken and stirred into new forms, including the smashing two-character “Heisenberg,” seen on Broadway last season with Mary-Louise Parker and Denis Arndt. Now the Atlantic Theater Company, which gave us a fine production of Mr. Stephens’s “Harper Regan” in 2012, presents the New York premiere of his “On the Shore of the Wide World,” a delicately drawn map of roads not taken by three generations of a family in Mr. Stephens’s native Stockport, England.
